0.title: Foxconn hikes daily bonuses by 4 times for staff amid COVID-19 curbs in China
0.article_body: After videos showed workers escaping from iPhone maker Foxconn’s Zhengzhou plant in China amid COVID-19 restrictions, Foxconn has quadrupled bonuses to retain staff at the manufacturing site. According to the WeChat account of Foxconn's Zhengzhou plant, daily bonuses for employees have been raised to 400 yuan for November from 100 yuan. Foxconn produces 70% of iPhone shipments globally.

1.title: I lost control after Olympics and gained weight: Neeraj Chopra
1.article_body: India's Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra, in a recent interview, said that he lost control after winning the gold medal at Olympics and gained weight. "Now I am controlling but in training...I know if I eat a paratha or something the coach will make me pay for it during training the next day," the 24-year-old said.

2.title: Europeans ask me if Indians have to return the money parents spend on raising them: Neeraj
2.article_body: India's Olympic gold medal-winning javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra, in an interview, said people in Europe ask him if Indians have to return the money parents spend on raising them after they start earning. "I tell them it’s different here. I think it’s only in our culture that even after growing up we live with our parents as kids," Neeraj said.

3.title: SaaS startup Icertis raises $150 million from Silicon Valley Bank
3.article_body: Software-as-a-service (SaaS) startup Icertis has secured $150 million through revolving credit facility and convertible debt from US-based Silicon Valley Bank. After the latest funding round, the company's total capital has reached $520 million. The company was co-founded by former Aztecsoft CEO Samir Bodas and former BladeLogic executive Monish Darda in 2009.

4.title: Couple, maid found dead under mysterious circumstances in Delhi
4.article_body: A couple and their maid were found dead at their residence in Delhi's Hari Nagar area under mysterious circumstances, police said on Tuesday. The CCTV footage of the area is being analysed to identify the culprits and a murder case has been filed, according to the police. Officials said that the couple's two-year-old daughter was found safe, according to reports.

5.title: 2 men stab dog to death after it constantly barks at them for days in MP
5.article_body: Two men aged between 20 and 25 years stabbed a stray dog to death using a knife in Madhya Pradesh. The two said that the dog had been constantly barking at them for days. An official said that the two accused got angry after the dog barked at them again on Sunday night. The dog died on the spot.

6.title: Didn't sleep, helped people entire night: Eyewitness of Morbi bridge collapse
6.article_body: An eyewitness to Gujarat's Morbi bridge collapse incident said that he saw people hanging from cables and then slipping down. The eyewitness, who sells tea near the bridge every Sunday, said, "I didn't sleep and helped people the entire night. It was heart-wrenching to see a 7-8-month-pregnant woman die. Never saw anything like that in my life," he added.

7.title: Police destroy 400 kg of drugs seized in 133 cases in Ambala
7.article_body: Police have destroyed 400 kg of drugs which had been seized in 133 cases at a waste management unit in Haryana's Ambala on Monday. The drugs included 2.98 kg of chura post, 91.8 kg of ganja, 900 gm of heroin, 1.5 kg of sulfa, 10 gm of charas and several intoxicant capsules, tablets, injections and syrups, a police spokesperson said.

8.title: Was forced to pay ₹10 cr to AAP's Satyendar Jain as 'protection money': Conman Sukesh
8.article_body: In a letter to Delhi L-G VK Saxena, jailed conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar has alleged that he was forced to pay ₹10 crore to Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader Satyendar Jain as "protection money". Sukesh said that a total amount of ₹50 crore was paid to the AAP as he was promised an important party position in south India.

9.title: Video of monkey drinking beer near UP liquor shop goes viral; shopkeepers file complaint
9.article_body: A video showing monkey drinking beer near a liquor shop in Uttar Pradesh's Raebareli is going viral on social media. The liquor shopkeepers in the region complained against the monkey accusing it of stealing alcohol from their shops and also snatching bottles from their customers. District Excise Officer Rajendra Pratap Singh said efforts are being made to catch the monkey.

10.title: GST collections rise to ₹1.52 lakh crore in October, 2nd highest ever
10.article_body: India collected ₹1.52 lakh crore in Goods and Services Tax (GST) in October, marking the second-highest monthly collection ever after that in April 2022, the Finance Ministry said. The monthly GST revenues have been over ₹1.40 lakh crore for eight straight months. In October, central GST was ₹26,039 crore, state GST was ₹33,396 crore and integrated GST was ₹81,778 crore.

11.title: Toyota Motor's Q2 profit falls by 25%, FY output target cut to 9.2 mn
11.article_body: Toyota Motor reported a 25% fall in second-quarter operating profit to 562.7 billion yen ($3.79 billion) as against a 749.9-billion yen profit in the corresponding period last year. Toyota said last week that its global production rebounded by 30% in the September quarter. However, it cut its fiscal output target to 9.2 million vehicles on continuing risks to chip supply.

12.title: 4 sickened by carbon dioxide release at Los Angeles airport
12.article_body: Four people, a woman and three men, were sickened by a release of carbon dioxide in a Los Angeles International Airport utility room on Monday. All people hurt in the incident were airport employees and one man is in grave condition, officials said. "The carbon dioxide displaced the oxygen in his bloodstream and he went into cardiac arrest," they said.

13.title: India reports 1,046 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 17,618
13.article_body: India reported 1,046 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 1,326 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India now stand at 17,618. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,29,077 following 53 casualties in the last 24 hours.

14.title: Afghanistan crash out of T20 World Cup 2022 semi-finals race after losing to Sri Lanka
14.article_body: Sri Lanka defeated Afghanistan by six wickets in their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage Group 1 match on Tuesday. Afghanistan put up a total of 144/8 in their 20 overs, with Sri Lanka chasing down the target in 18.3 overs. With this, Afghanistan have crashed out of the T20 World Cup 2022 semi-finals race.

15.title: Google pauses Play Store billing in India after ₹936-crore fine by CCI
15.article_body: Google has paused its plans to enforce the Play billing system on Indian developers from October 31 following the ruling by the Competition Commission of India. CCI imposed two fines on Google, one worth ₹936.44 crore for abusing its dominant position in reference to Play Store policies and the second for ₹1,338 crore for abusing dominance in Android device market.

16.title: Stuff of dreams: Satwik after winning historic Super 750 title with Chirag
16.article_body: Reacting to becoming the first Indian doubles pair to win a Super 750 title alongside Chirag Shetty, Satwiksairaj Rankireddy took to Instagram to share, "I am thrilled beyond words and humbled beyond comparison!" "[It] is definitely the stuff of dreams! But not a moment longer to rest on our laurels, bigger goals [and] bigger titles are ahead," added Satwiksairaj.

17.title: HC bar association goes on strike over NIA seizing lawyer's phone
17.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court Bar Association decided to go on an indefinite strike on Monday over the National Investigation Agency (NIA) not returning the phone of a lawyer which it had seized during a raid in October. The lawyer, whose house was raided, has been representing some gangsters. The bar association had suspended work over the issue in October.

18.title: Bappi Lahiri's 'Jimmy Jimmy' being used by Chinese citizens to protest COVID lockdowns
18.article_body: Bappi Lahiri's song 'Jimmy Jimmy' is being used by Chinese citizens to protest COVID-19 lockdowns in the country. In videos that went viral, the song is sung in Mandarin as "Jie mi, jie mi", which translates to "Give me rice, give me rice". People posted the video to show how they have been deprived of essential food items during lockdowns.

19.title: Maha aarti to resume at Mumbai's Banganga after 2 years
19.article_body: The Maha aarti at Banganga in Mumbai will be started again after a gap of two years. The aarti will be held on November 7 at 7 pm. Over 1,000 diyas will be lit during the aarti which is done on the occasion of Kartik Purnima, reports said. Many dignitaries including Chief Minister Eknath Shinde are invited to the event.

20.title: India adopted zero-tolerance approach to terrorism, says President Murmu
20.article_body: While addressing Heads of Delegations of the UN Security Council’s Counter-Terrorism Committee, President Droupadi Murmu emphasised that India has adopted a zero-tolerance approach to terrorism. She said, "India has been a victim of terrorism for decades…I’m confident that the discussions during the meeting will provide good foundations for concrete action by the international community."

21.title: It's one place where you hope to feel safe: Dravid on leaked video of Kohli's hotel room
21.article_body: Reacting to video of Virat Kohli's hotel room getting leaked online, Rahul Dravid said, "[Hotel room] is one place where you feel you are away from people's prying eyes and without the media glare on you." He added, "It is one place where you hope to feel secure and safe, and that's taken away...it's not really a nice feeling."

22.title: Has he also played for India? Shahid Afridi on Amit Mishra's tweet for Babar
22.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi reacted to veteran cricketer Amit Mishra's "This too shall pass, stay strong" tweet for Pakistan captain Babar Azam amid his poor form. "Has Amit Mishra also played for India? Was he a spinner or batter?" Afridi said on TV. Notably, Babar had posted a similar tweet for Virat Kohli when the latter was battling poor form.

23.title: WB man rapes girl to get her blood for removing marriage obstacles
23.article_body: A 37-year-old man allegedly raped an eight-year-old girl in West Bengal's Bankura to get blood from her private parts believing that it'd help remove the obstacles to his marriage, police said on Monday. A tantrik told the man that his problems would be solved if he brought a cloth soaked in blood from a minor girl's private parts, police added.

24.title: No water, power supply in much of Kyiv amid Russian attacks
24.article_body: Russian cruise missile and drone strikes hit infrastructure in Ukrainian cities including Kyiv and Kharkiv on Monday, knocking out water and power supplies. Russian President Vladimir Putin said bombardment was in retaliation for an unsuccessful Ukrainian aerial and underwater drone attack on Russia's Black Sea Fleet. A Ukrainian official said the Kremlin was taking revenge for military failures.

25.title: 'Kantara' director Rishab Shetty says he won't do Hindi films
25.article_body: 'Kantara' director-actor Rishab Shetty was recently asked if he is willing to make his Bollywood debut. In response, Shetty said, "I don't do Hindi movies. I dub my Kannada movies into Hindi. I have no plans to enter Hindi cinema." Earlier, talking about his Kannada film 'Kantara', Rishab stated that the film shouldn't be remade in Hindi.

26.title: Musk changed Twitter's homepage in less than 24 hours after taking control: Report
26.article_body: Elon Musk decided to change Twitter's homepage in less than 24 hours after taking control of the company on Friday, The Verge reported. Logged out users visiting Twitter.com are now redirected to the Explore page that shows trending tweets and news stories. Earlier, people who visited Twitter's homepage while logged out of their accounts were only showed a sign-up form.

27.title: Hospital where Morbi bridge victims are admitted painted overnight for PM's visit
27.article_body: The civil hospital in Gujarat's Morbi, where victims of the suspension bridge collapse are admitted, was painted overnight for Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit on Tuesday. Over 130 people lost their lives in the bridge collapse. Reports said that new water coolers were brought in and bedsheets were changed in the two wards where the victims have been admitted.

28.title: Thane suicide victim accused 2 for cheating him of ₹17 lakh in video: Police
28.article_body: The family of a 40-year-old man who died by suicide on October 10 in Thane's Mumbra said that he had made a video before dying and said two people owed him ₹17 lakh for supplies they purchased from him. "The video mentions names of two persons," police said. He was under stress and told his family that he was cheated.

29.title: 38-yr-old Hyd engineer drowns in well while playing 'treasure hunt'
29.article_body: A 38-year-old engineer from Hyderabad, Sai Kumar, drowned in a 30-foot-deep well while playing a 'treasure hunt'. Kumar went to Hyderabad Adventure Club’s Moonlight Camping in Godhumaguda village along with his friends and colleagues on Saturday, police said. While playing, Kumar went into the well to collect one of the clues and drowned. Police registered a 'negligence' case against organisers.

30.title: Russia recruiting US-trained ex-Afghan soldiers to fight in Ukraine: Report
30.article_body: Russia is recruiting soldiers from Afghan special forces who fought alongside US troops and fled to Iran after US troop withdrawal from Afghanistan, The Associated Press reported citing former Afghan generals. Russians are reportedly offering Afghan soldiers $1,500-a-month payments and promises of safe havens. One of the generals said commandos fear being killed by Taliban if they return.

31.title: Weinstein sexually assaulted me twice in same hotel 17 yrs apart: Former actress
31.article_body: A former actress has testified that Harvey Weinstein sexually assaulted her during the Toronto International Film Festival in 1991 and then again when she went to confront him in the same hotel 17 years later. Kelly Sipherd, who was an aspiring actor in the 80-90s, said she didn't tell anyone about the second assault for years because of "sheer embarrassment".

32.title: Gangster's 6 illegal properties worth ₹20 cr demolished in Gurugram
32.article_body: Gurugram district administration and police on Monday demolished six properties worth ₹20 crore constructed over 600 square yards. The properties were built on Haryana Shehri Vikas Pradhikaran land in Sector 33 which was allegedly encroached upon by the family members of gangster Kaushal. His family members illegally grabbed it and built houses and shops, an official said.

33.title: Parts of Hyderabad likely to receive rainfall in next 3 days
33.article_body: Hyderabad is likely to receive rains in the next three days as the northeast monsoon that brings downpours to Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, and coastal Andhra Pradesh has set in over the eastern coast. Hyderabad will witness cloudy sky and haze or mist will prevail over the zone till November 4, as per India Meteorological Department (IMD) forecast.

34.title: Doesn't help even if you have Messi if I'm not there: Zlatan on Ligue 1
34.article_body: Ex-PSG player Zlatan Ibrahimović said the Ligue 1 has deteriorated since he left, adding that there is "nothing to talk about" anymore. "France needs me. I don't need France. Even if you have Kylian Mbappé, Neymar and Lionel Messi, it doesn't help you," added Ibrahimović. "Why? Because you don't have God," he stated. Ibrahimović is currently representing AC Milan.

35.title: Crowd control at site of Halloween crush was inadequate: S Korea police
35.article_body: South Korea's police chief said crowd control in the area where a crush killed more than 150 party-goers in Seoul was "inadequate". Yoon Hee-keun added that the police response was "disappointing", and he felt heavy responsibility for what happened. The incident took place on Saturday night (October 29) as crowds gathered in an alley in Itaewon to celebrate Halloween.

36.title: India's manufacturing PMI rises to 55.3 in October
36.article_body: India's manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) compiled by S&P Global, which measures manufacturing sector activity, surged to 55.3 in October from 55.1 in September. The manufacturing PMI surge indicated stronger increases in employment and stocks of purchases even as price pressures remained contained, S&P said. This is the 16th consecutive 50-plus print for the manufacturing PMI.

37.title: Babil has, what I call, the God particle: Anvitaa Dutt
37.article_body: Director Anvitaa Dutt's 'Qala' marks the acting debut of Irrfan Khan's son Babil Khan. Anvitaa said Babil had stepped into the shoes of his 'Qala' character Jagan "like they were meant for him". "Babil has, what I call, the God particle - that special something you can't explain...but can sense it every time he's in the frame," she added.

38.title: T'gana weavers send lakhs of postcards to PM Modi seeking exemption from GST
38.article_body: Weavers from across Telangana on Monday sent lakhs of postcards to PM Narendra Modi seeking the Centre's support for the handloom industry and exemption from the GST. "Narendra Modi is the first PM to apply a tax on handlooms…We [all] request [him] to allocate more budget and bring back all the schemes that were removed earlier," said MLC L Ramana.

39.title: Minorities from Afghanistan, Pak, B'desh to get citizenship in 2 Guj districts
39.article_body: Ministry of Home Affairs on Monday issued a notification empowering collectors in Gujarat's Mahesana and Anand districts to grant citizenship to minority communities from Afghanistan, Pakistan and Bangladesh. The minority communities include Hindus, Sikhs, Parsis, Christians, Buddhists and Jains. Citizenship will be granted under the Citizenship Act, 1955 and not Citizenship (Amendment) Act, 2019.

40.title: Twitter limits employee access to content moderation tools: Report
40.article_body: Twitter has limited employee access to internal tools used for content moderation, Bloomberg reported. Most employees in Twitter's Trust and Safety team are currently unable to alter or penalise accounts for violations like misleading information and hate speech, the report said. Twitter's new owner Elon Musk last week said he hadn't made "any changes to Twitter's content moderation policies" yet.

41.title: Twitter's credit rating lowered by Moody's after Musk's takeover
41.article_body: Moody's Investors Service has lowered Twitter's corporate family rating (CFR) and senior unsecured notes ratings to B1 from Ba2 following Elon Musk's acquisition of the platform. "Twitter's governance risk is highly negative reflecting Moody's expectation for aggressive financial policies and concentrated ownership by Elon Musk," Moody's said. Musk closed his acquisition of Twitter last week.

42.title: 25-year-old man loses ₹10,000 in sextortion fraud in Mumbai's Powai
42.article_body: A 25-year-old man from Mumbai's Powai area has been cheated of ₹10,000 in a sextortion fraud. The victim came across a woman on a dating app, who later on indulged in obscenity with him on a WhatsApp video call. She then threatened him to share the video on social media and asked him to pay ₹20,000 through a QR Code.

43.title: Last segment of elevated route for PCMC-Range Hill metro stretch launched
43.article_body: Pune Metro on Monday launched the last segment of the 12.064-kilometre elevated metro rail route from Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) to Range Hill station. A total of 3,934 segments were cast for the route and a total of 451 spans were constructed through these segments. The trial run will be done from Phugewadi station to Civil Court station.

44.title: 5 men gangrape 14-year-old Class 10 girl in Gurugram hotel
44.article_body: Five men allegedly gangraped a 14-year-old Class 10 girl after taking her to a hotel in Gurugram, police said. Two of the five accused have been arrested. The girl told her mother that she was taken to the hotel by her two friends on a bike where the two youths and three others allegedly raped her, the police added.

45.title: Was persuaded not to choose 'Gunjan...', but followed my gut: Janhvi
45.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor said she was persuaded not to choose 'Gunjan Saxena: The Kargil Girl', 'Good Luck Jerry' and 'Mili' as they were "unconventional choices", but she followed her gut. Stating that she's not a "calculative" actress, Janhvi added that she's happy with her career choices. Janhvi's upcoming film 'Mili' is the Hindi remake of the Malayalam film Helen (2019).

46.title: Musk tells EU Twitter will follow its content policing rules: Report
46.article_body: Elon Musk has assured EU's industry chief Thierry Breton that Twitter will abide by Europe's Digital Services Act rules on illegal online content policing, Reuters reported citing sources. Earlier, after Musk tweeted, "The bird is freed," post his Twitter acquisition, Breton quote-tweeted him saying, "In Europe, the bird will fly by our rules."

47.title: Guj CM must resign: Digvijaya Singh on Morbi bridge collapse incident
47.article_body: Congress leader Digvijaya Singh has demanded the resignation of Gujarat CM Bhupendra Patel over the Morbi bridge collapse incident. "This isn't a man-made but a government-made tragedy and the Gujarat CM must...tender his resignation. Why were so many people allowed to come on the bridge? The liability must be fixed and culprits must be arrested at the earliest," Singh added.

48.title: 'Pulp Fiction' actor Tim Roth's son Cormac Roth dies at 25 due to germ cell cancer
48.article_body: Musician Cormac Roth, the son of 'Pulp Fiction' actor Tim Roth, has died at the age of 25. The guitarist and composer had been diagnosed with stage 3 germ cell cancer in November 2021. "He was a wild and electric ball of energy and his spirit was filled with light and goodness," a statement from his family read.

49.title: 2 killed as fire breaks out at footwear factory in Delhi's Narela Industrial Area
49.article_body: At least two persons were killed as a fire broke out at a footwear factory in Delhi's Narela Industrial Area. As many as 10 fire tenders were rushed to the spot and a few people are feared trapped, Delhi Fire Service said. "A few are injured...have been shifted to hospital, all are stable and have minor injuries," Delhi Police said.

50.title: Actress Rambha, her kids injured in car accident in Canada; shares pics
50.article_body: Actress Rambha and her kids were injured in a car accident in Canada. The actress shared pictures on Instagram and wrote, "Our car was hit by another car at an intersection wayback from picking kids from school...my little Sasha is still in the hospital. Bad days bad time. Please pray for us, your prayers mean a lot."

51.title: Delhi's air quality turns 'severe'; AQI crosses 400 mark
51.article_body: The 24-hour average air quality index (AQI) in Delhi was in 'severe' category as the national capital recorded an average AQI of 426 at 9.10 am on Tuesday, according to Central Pollution Control Board's data. Meanwhile, the AQI in Gurugram was 399, while it was 397 in Noida. Some relief is expected from November 2, a senior SAFAR official said.

52.title: SC to hear PIL seeking court-monitored probe in Morbi bridge mishap on Nov 14
52.article_body: The Supreme Court has agreed to hear a PIL seeking direction to immediately appoint a judicial commission under the supervision of a retired top court judge to initiate an investigation into the Morbi bridge collapse case. The apex court will hear the PIL on November 14, news agency ANI reported. Over 130 people were killed in the incident.

53.title: Felt like my heart's been ripped out: Rio on losing 2009, 2011 CL final
53.article_body: Ex-Manchester United player Rio Ferdinand said he felt like his heart's been "ripped out" after his team's defeats in the 2009 and 2011 Champions League finals against Barcelona. "I was...as drunk as I've ever been for both...the finals...The party was crazy because you're drowning your sorrows," added Ferdinand. Discussing the 2011 Champions League, Ferdinand stated, "Barcelona...took our soul."

54.title: Imran Khan to file PKR 10 bn lawsuit against Pak Election Commission chief
54.article_body: Pakistan's former PM Imran Khan has said that he'll file a PKR 10 billion (₹373 crore) defamation lawsuit against Election Commission of Pakistan (ECP) chief, Sikandar Raja, for destroying his reputation by disqualifying him from holding public office. Khan was disqualified last month after the ECP found him guilty of unlawfully selling gifts from foreign dignitaries and heads of state.

55.title: BYJU'S served 'performance notices' to over 5,000 employees: Report
55.article_body: BYJU'S has served 'performance notices' to more than 5,000 employees across departments out of its 50,000-workforce, Moneycontrol reported. BYJU'S sales executives who failed to meet over 70% of their weekly sales target for eight weeks will be evaluated and appropriate action will be taken, the report said. BYJU'S denied the report saying there hasn't been any change in payment structure.

56.title: Amritsar petrol pump guard shoots robbers who came to loot station, kills 1
56.article_body: A guard at a petrol pump in Amritsar shot at two robbers who had allegedly come to loot the station, reports said. One of the robbers was killed. "Police reached the spot and started an investigation. CCTV footage [is] being searched," Gurmeet Singh, DSP, Amritsar, said. Reports added that the second robber ran away from the spot.

57.title: 6,997 drug smugglers arrested in last 4 months, ₹4.49 cr seized: Punjab Police
57.article_body: As many as 6,997 drug smugglers were arrested while a total of 5,346 FIRs were registered in the last four months in Punjab Police's ongoing drive against narcotics, police said. Police also recovered ₹4.49 crore of cash from the possession of drug smugglers arrested in these four months, Inspector General of Police (Headquarters) Sukhchain Singh Gill said.

58.title: How about $8: Musk as Stephen King says he'll quit Twitter if asked to pay $20 for blue tick
58.article_body: After reports claimed that Twitter may charge $20/month for blue tick badge, author Stephen King tweeted, "$20 a month to keep my blue check? F*** that, they should pay me. If that gets instituted, I'm gone like Enron." Responding to him, Elon Musk tweeted, "We need to pay the bills somehow! Twitter cannot rely entirely on advertisers. How about $8?"

59.title: Prefer not to be monster of tennis: Djokovic on record against top players
59.article_body: Discussing his impressive record against top players, Novak Djokovic said, "I prefer not to be the monster of tennis...[However]...the record against most of the top players...is positive, which is great." "I have managed to do well throughout my career," added Djokovic. Djokovic was forced to miss the Australian Open and US Open in 2022 as he is unvaccinated.

60.title: Kohli chose not to file official complaint over leaked video of his hotel room: Report
60.article_body: Virat Kohli chose not to file an official complaint with the hotel in Perth after a video of his room got leaked, Indian Express reported. As per the report, Kohli was asked by team management if he wanted to lodge complaint, but he declined. "From his point of view...the issue won’t be pursued further," a team source told Indian Express.

61.title: One kid who refuses to get out of our bed: Mira Rajput on Ishaan's birthday
61.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor's wife Mira Rajput took to Instagram to share a picture of herself, Shahid Kapoor and Ishaan Khatter to wish the latter on his birthday. "We have 2 kids that sleep in their own beds but one who refuses to get out of ours...Happy Birthday @ishaankhatter you know we love you tons," she wrote.

62.title: Over 40% consumers did not opt for power subsidy: Delhi govt
62.article_body: More than 40% of Delhi's 56.98 lakh domestic consumers have not chosen to take benefit of the government's electricity subsidies, the Delhi government officials said. The deadline to apply for subsidy ended on October 31. The officials further said that those who were not able to register will have another chance to do so during the next month's billing cycle.

63.title: Speeding car coming from wrong side hits bike in Gurugram; 1 dead
63.article_body: An 18-year-old boy was killed and his relative was seriously injured after a speeding car coming from the wrong side rammed into the motorcycle the duo was riding on in Gurugram's Sector 68, police said on Monday. The teenager had died on the spot due to bleeding, investigators said. An FIR has been filed against the car's driver.

64.title: B'luru man gets 5-year jail for celebrating Pulwama killings on Facebook
64.article_body: A special court in Bengaluru imprisoned a man, Faiz Rasheed, for five years and fined him ₹10,000 over derogatory Facebook posts about the Pulwama terrorist attack. He's a third-semester engineering student and a resident of Kacharakanahalli. He was arrested in 2019 and since then he has been lodged in prison as his bail petition was rejected.

65.title: Boy who came in contact with power cable dies in Pune; probe on
65.article_body: A probe has been launched following the death of a 14-year-old boy who came in contact with Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited's (MSEDCL) overhead power cable in Pune in October. The deceased's family conducted a protest march on Monday at an MSEDCL office and demanded action against officials responsible. Financial aid is being extended to boy's family, MSEDCL said.

66.title: Priyanka to meet Vishal Bhardwaj & Sanjay Leela Bhansali: Report
66.article_body: Priyanka Chopra will reportedly meet Sanjay Leela Bhansali and Vishal Bhardwaj during her India trip to discuss her possible Bollywood collaborations. Priyanka had previously collaborated with Sanjay for 'Bajirao Mastani', while she had featured in Vishal Bhardwaj's '7 Khoon Maaf'. Priyanka will also be seen in Farhan Akhtar's 'Jee Le Zaraa', which will also star Alia Bhatt and Katrina Kaif.

67.title: Sneak peek of how organised you're, it's inspiring: Mukti on Virat's room video
67.article_body: While commenting on the leaked video of his room shared by Virat Kohli, dancer Mukti Mohan said that it is inspiring how the video shows that Kohli is organised. "That's horrid behaviour from the well-suited educated men...You will always have our respect champ...keep shining on the field and in life," Mukti commented on Kohli's post.

68.title: I haven't seen an innings like that: Misbah on Suryakumar's 68 vs SA
68.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Misbah-ul-Haq said he "hasn't seen an innings" similar to Suryakumar Yadav's 68 off 40 balls in India's T20 World Cup 2022 match against South Africa. "He's the best middle-order batter in T20 cricket...It seemed as if he knew where the ball would land and where he can hit it," added Misbah. Suryakumar smashed three sixes during his knock.

69.title: BMC announces 10% water cut in Mumbai for 10 days
69.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation announced on Monday that there will be a 10% water cut in Mumbai Metropolitan region, Thane and Bhiwandi Municipal Corporations from November 1 to 10 due to urgent repair work. "All citizens are requested to use water judiciously. Citizens' co-operation to Municipal Administration during this period is requested," the BMC said.

70.title: 'Scary' sound of Earth's magnetic field released by space agency
70.article_body: The European Space Agency (ESA) has released an audio which reveals how the Earth's magnetic field sounds like. "We are celebrating [Halloween] by listening to the scary sound of Earth’s magnetic field," ESA wrote. "Scientists at the Technical University of Denmark have taken magnetic signals measured by ESA's Swarm satellite mission and converted them into sound," it added.

71.title: We'll thrive again, not having any takeover discussions: Credit Suisse Chairman
71.article_body: Credit Suisse Chairman Axel Lehmann during an interview said, "We are going to thrive again, so we don’t have any takeover discussions." He added, "We want to stay independent." Notably, the company's share price has declined by more than half this year and it is also starting initial headcount reductions of 2,700 positions in the fourth quarter.

72.title: Axis Bank stock falls by over 2% after 1.3% stake sold via block deals
72.article_body: Shares of Axis Bank declined by over 2% on Tuesday after 4.1 crore shares or 1.3% equity worth ₹3,654 crore changed hands at an average of ₹894/piece. A US-based private investment company Bain Capital was reportedly looking to sell its 1.24% stake in the lender via block deals. At 10:10 am, Axis Bank's stock was trading 2.24% lower on NSE.

73.title: Village head, wife and mother shot dead while asleep in UP's Budaun
73.article_body: A 58-year-old village head, his 54-year-old wife and his 80-year-old mother were shot dead by unidentified assailants at their residence in Satra village in Uttar Pradesh's Budaun on Monday, police said. The victims were asleep at the time of the incident, police added. "During interrogation, it was found that there was enmity between family members," SSP Budaun OP Singh said.

74.title: 24-year-old Indian businessman shot dead by policeman in Uganda: Reports
74.article_body: A 24-year-old Indian businessman identified as Kuntaj Patel was shot dead by a policeman in Uganda, according to local reports. Patel's employee reportedly said that he and his boss were attending a client when the policeman entered their shop, aimed the gun at Patel and shot him in the chest. The accused has reportedly been charged with murder.

75.title: No objectification of woman, her body parts: Kangana on Madhubala's 'Aaiye...'
75.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut said that Madhubala's 'Aaiye Meharban' has "no objectification of woman and her body parts". "Sensuality and seduction [have] nothing to do with vulgarity and raunchy item numbers...this song has everything," she added. She wrote this as she shared a video clip of the song on her Instagram Stories.

76.title: Rahul is under a lot of pressure, he has gone into a shell: Uthappa
76.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Robin Uthappa said KL Rahul is under a "lot of pressure" having scored 22 runs so far in the three matches played till now by Team India in the T20 World Cup 2022. "It seems as if he has gone into a shell...Rahul's mind is clouded," added Uthappa. "I feel they should continue backing Rahul," he stated.

77.title: Depressed woman kills her children, attempts suicide in Navi Mumbai
77.article_body: A 32-year-old woman allegedly killed her two children and attempted suicide on Sunday evening in Navi Mumbai's Ghansoli village. Before taking the step, she had informed her husband that she was feeling depressed and experiencing extreme mood swings. Her husband used to sell ice-cream on a hand cart and had a loan to pay back.

78.title: Price of commercial 19-kg LPG cylinder cut by ₹115.50
78.article_body: The price of commercial liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) cylinders was cut by ₹115.50 on Tuesday. A 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder will now cost ₹1,744 in Delhi. However, the price of the 14.2 kg domestic LPG cylinder has been kept unchanged. A 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder will now cost ₹1,846 in Kolkata, ₹1,696 in Mumbai and ₹1,893 in Chennai.

79.title: Brazilian truckers block roads in protest of Bolsonaro’s election defeat
79.article_body: Truckers in Brazil protested the defeat of outgoing President Jair Bolsonaro on Monday by blocking roads in 20 states. Video footage showed some truckers at roadblocks calling for a military coup to prevent Lula da Silva from becoming the President. Lula, who'll become the President for the third time, won 50.9% of the votes compared with 49.1% for Bolsonaro.

80.title: West Bengal girl kills self as video of her stealing chocolates goes viral
80.article_body: A third-year undergraduate student died by suicide in West Bengal after a video of her stealing chocolates from a store in a shopping mall went viral. Her father said that she paid the price of the chocolates and also apologised to the store authorities. However, people at the store made a video of the whole incident and posted it online.

81.title: Halt 'useless' joint military drills with S Korea: North Korea to US
81.article_body: North Korea has demanded that US and South Korea stop large-scale military exercises in the region, calling them a "provocation". "If...US doesn't want any serious developments not suited to its security interests, it should stop the useless and ineffective war exercises at once. If not, it'll have to...take the blame for all...consequences," North Korea said. The drills began on Monday.

82.title: Fire breaks out at building that houses ex-cricketer Zaheer Khan's restaurant in Pune
82.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a building in Maharashtra's Pune on Tuesday morning. The top floor of the Marvel Vista building located at the city's Lulla Nagar Chowk caught fire. The building houses a restaurant owned by former India cricketer Zaheer Khan on the ground floor. No casualties or injuries have been reported so far.

83.title: Janhvi insisted we shoot in freezer with -8 to -12°C temperature: Boney on Mili
83.article_body: Film producer Boney Kapoor said that his daughter and actress Janhvi Kapoor is an enthusiastic actor. While speaking about the film 'Mili', he said, "She [Janhvi] insisted on shooting in an actual freezer where the temperature was...minus 8 to minus 12 degrees Celsius. In the second half of the film...it is only through her expressions that everything is conveyed."

84.title: Hyderabad Police mandates Anti-Drug Committees in all colleges
84.article_body: In a bid to spread awareness against the possession, consumption and sale of narcotic drugs and psychotropic substances, Hyderabad Police has mandated the setting up of an Anti-Drug Committee (ADC) in all city colleges and similar institutions. Commissioner of Police CV Anand said that police have now adopted a strategic move to insulate increasingly vulnerable youngsters in colleges.

85.title: Kyiv mayor urges EU leaders to maintain political, economic aid to Ukraine
85.article_body: During an interview with DW, mayor of Kyiv, Vitali Klitschko, urged European Union leaders to maintain political and economic aid to Ukraine. "Please stay with Ukraine...we are fighting and defending not just our homes and our country. We are defending every one of you in Europe", Klitschko said. He warned that Russian President Vladimir Putin won't stop at invading Ukraine.

86.title: Omar claims Ladakh authorities tried to stop him from visiting Kargil
86.article_body: National Conference leader Omar Abdullah has claimed that authorities in Ladakh tried to dissuade him from visiting Kargil and told him "not to come here". "There (Eastern Ladakh) China has come...you couldn't stop them...We are only going from Srinagar to Kargil via Drass," he said. He also alleged that he wasn't allowed to use a public address system in Drass.

87.title: Himachal Pradesh BJP expels 5 of its rebel leaders for 6 years
87.article_body: Himachal Pradesh BJP expelled five of its rebel leaders, including BJP state vice-president Kripal Parmar, from primary membership for six years. The others include former Kinnaur MLA, Tejwant Negi, former Anni MLA, Kishori Lal, former Indora MLA, Manohar Dhiman and former Nalagarh MLA, KL Thakur. They were indulging in anti-party activities, BJP state president Suresh Kashyap said.

88.title: Incredibly disappointed by gross invasion of privacy: ICC on leaked video of Kohli's hotel room
88.article_body: Reacting to the leaked video of Virat Kohli's hotel room in Perth, ICC said, "We're incredibly disappointed by the gross invasion of privacy suffered by a member of...Indian travelling party at Crown Perth." It added, "We continue to work with event hotels and security providers to ensure...this remains an isolated incident and player privacy is fully respected at all times."

89.title: Morbi bridge renovated by administration, no role of Guj govt: Ex-Dy CM
89.article_body: Following the Morbi bridge collapse incident, ex-Gujarat Deputy CM Nitin Patel said renovation and opening of the bridge were done by Morbi administration and the Gujarat government didn't have any role in it, direct or indirect. "Oreva is an old company for repairing watches...only Morbi municipality knows on which qualification it handed over the work of bridge renovation," Patel added.

90.title: Saudi Prince Alwaleed, Jack Dorsey among top investors in Twitter after Musk takeover
90.article_body:
As Elon Musk took over Twitter, regulatory filings revealed a list of top investors in the company. 
Saudi Arabia's Kingdom Holding Company, along with the private office of Prince Alwaleed bin Talal moved almost 35 million Twitter shares worth about $1.9 billion to become the "second-largest" investor in the new parent company. Jack Dorsey moved over 18 million shares.

91.title: Speeding car rams into Warkari procession in Maharashtra; 7 killed
91.article_body: Seven people were killed and several others injured after a speeding car rammed into a procession of Warkaris (pilgrims) in Maharashtra's Solapur on Monday, police said. The accident apparently occurred after car's 75-year-old driver lost control, according to police. State CM Eknath Shinde expressed grief over the incident and announced a ₹5 lakh ex-gratia for each of the deceased's families.

92.title: Aviation turbine fuel price hiked by 4.3% to ₹1.2 lakh/kl in Delhi
92.article_body: Price of aviation turbine fuel (ATF) was increased by 4.3% to ₹1.2 lakh/kilolitre from ₹1.1 lakh/kilolitre in Delhi on Tuesday. On October 1, ATF price was slashed by ₹5,521.17/kilolitre to ₹1.15 lakh/kilolitre. The price of a 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder was also reduced by ₹115 in Delhi with effect from Tuesday. A 19-kg cylinder will now cost ₹1,744 in Delhi.

93.title: Taylor becomes 1st artist to claim top 10 slots of Billboard Hot 100 chart
93.article_body: Taylor Swift has become the first artist in history to claim Billboard Hot 100 chart's top 10 slots for a week with her new album 'Midnights'. Taylor has surpassed Drake, who had held the previous record with nine of the top 10 songs for a week in September 2021. "I'm in shambles," Taylor tweeted in reaction to the news.

94.title: What can I say: Ayushmann as friend reminds Tahira of wrong anniversary date
94.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana reacted after his wife Tahira Kashyap forgot their wedding anniversary date and posted a picture to wish him one day before the anniversary. Tahira said that she was reminded by a friend that she got the anniversary date wrong. "What can I say now? Happy anniversary in advance," Ayushmann wrote.

95.title: Actress Sonali Chakraborty passes away aged 59 in Kolkata
95.article_body: Bengali actress Sonali Chakraborty passed away at a private hospital in Kolkata aged 59 on Monday following a prolonged illness. Chakraborty was suffering from liver complications and was undergoing treatment at the hospital for months. She is survived by her actor-husband Shankar Chakraborty and their daughter.

96.title: 29-yr-old Delhi man frustrated over breakup shoots ex-girlfriend to death
96.article_body: A 29-year-old man killed his former girlfriend as he was allegedly frustrated over their breakup in Delhi, reports said. The accused was hiding in different hotels to escape arrest. Police said that there was no CCTV footage available for the incident and the arrest was made based on technical surveillance. Gunshot wounds were found on the woman's body.

97.title: Zomato restores woman's review on B'luru eatery over food poisoning, CEO thanks her
97.article_body: Zomato has reinstated the negative review made by a woman who claimed she and her colleague suffered severe food poisoning after eating at a Bengaluru restaurant. The review was removed on grounds of mentioning health code violations, Zomato earlier said. "We have removed this policy with immediate effect...Thank you for...influencing positive change," Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal told the woman.

98.title: Social media sites should proactively flag fake news: CEC Rajiv Kumar
98.article_body: The election management bodies expect social media sites to use their "algorithm power" to proactively flag fake news, Chief Election Commissioner (CEC) Rajiv Kumar said. Kumar said that social media platforms proclaim to have content policies but added that they do also have the "algorithm power" and a proactive approach to countering fake news would facilitate "credible electoral outcomes".

99.title: Trump's real estate firm cheated tax authorities for 15 years: Prosecutor
99.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump's real estate company cheated tax authorities for 15 years, prosecutor Susan Hoffinger said during a criminal tax fraud trial. Hoffinger added that the company paid certain executives, including former CFO Allen Weisselberg, in perks like rent and cars without disclosing it to tax authorities. If convicted, the Trump Organisation could face $1.6 million in fines.

100.title: iPhone output could fall by 30% at China plant amid COVID-19 curbs: Report
100.article_body: Apple iPhones' production could fall by nearly 30% at one of the world's biggest iPhone plants in China due to tightening of COVID-19 curbs in the country, Reuters quoted a source as saying. Several videos, circulated on social media, showed workers escaping from the Zhengzhou plant. Meanwhile, Foxconn is working to increase production at Shenzhen factory to meet the shortfall.

101.title: Twitter should repair the damage done to Trump: Mexican Prez
101.article_body: Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador on Monday urged the new owner of Twitter, Elon Musk, to "repair the damage done by the cancellation of [former US] President [Donald] Trump's account". Obrador also urged Musk to free the social media platform from what he described as "conservative control". Trump was banned from Twitter after the 2021 US Capitol riots.

102.title: Hyderabad to get multipurpose sports complex in Banjara Hills
102.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has taken up the construction of a multipurpose indoor sports complex in Banjara Hills at an estimated cost of ₹6 crore. The one lakh square feet complex will have a cricket box, kabaddi court, badminton and tennis courts. It will also have gyms and a place for yoga along with carrom and chess games.

103.title: 2 die, 4 admitted to hospital after consuming illicit liquor in Pune
103.article_body: At least two members of a family, aged 35 and 40, died after allegedly consuming illicit liquor at Malegaon in Pune's Baramati on Sunday, police said. Notably, four more people from the same family who had also consumed the same liquor were admitted to a hospital. "We have booked three people in this case," police added.

104.title: ₹69.95 crore-heroin hidden in trolley bag seized at Delhi airport
104.article_body: The Air Customs at IGI Airport in Delhi has seized heroin worth ₹69.95 crore which was hidden in the false bottom and the top of a trolley bag, the Customs department said on Monday. A Belizean national who was carrying the trolley bag was arrested under the NDPS Act. The accused had arrived in Delhi from Johannesburg via Doha.

105.title: Get all hanging bridges in K'taka evaluated: Cong leader after Morbi mishap
105.article_body: After more than 130 people lost their lives in the Morbi bridge collapse, Karnataka Congress spokesperson Nivedith Alva has urged the Karnataka administration to get steel hanging bridges evaluated urgently. "I would urge the state administration to...ensure that basic maintenance is being carried out. This is required...especially in coastal areas that see very heavy rain," he wrote on Twitter.

106.title: B'luru's Namma Metro launches QR code-based ticketing system on WhatsApp
106.article_body: Bengaluru's Namma Metro in partnership with WhatsApp launched a chatbot-based QR ticketing service enabling users to ride the metro without using tokens or smart cards. The chatbot is integrated with Unified Payments Interface (UPI) powered payments on WhatsApp. To use the service, commuters need to send 'Hi' to BMRCL's official WhatsApp chatbot number 9181055 56677.

107.title: Man being extorted & threatened by 2 women, kills self in Pune
107.article_body: A 34-year-old man allegedly died by suicide at his house in Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad, police said. According to a suicide note, which was found in the deceased's pocket, two women "extorted money and gold jewellery from the victim and threatened to share photographs of their physical relationship with his wife", a senior inspector said. The incident occurred on Saturday, police added.

108.title: 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz receives world number one trophy, shares pics
108.article_body: Spain's 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz received his world number one trophy in Paris on Monday evening. Sharing pictures on Instagram, Alcaraz wrote, "A special day! Today I received the world number one trophy in Paris! I should find somewhere to put it, no?" Alcaraz became the youngest men's world number one in tennis history in September this year.

109.title: What others see as 'layoff', I only see as time off: BYJU's CEO on rehiring fired staff
109.article_body: BYJU’s CEO Byju Raveendran sent an email to his employees after the recent layoffs at the company. On rehiring the laid-off employees, Byju wrote, "What others see as 'layoff', I only see as time off. Bringing you back...will now be...number one priority for me." He added that HR has been instructed to make new roles available to affected employees.

110.title: Think about your team instead of yourself: Gambhir on Babar Azam
110.article_body: Discussing Babar Azam's captaincy during Pakistan's T20 World Cup 2022 match against Netherlands, Gautam Gambhir said, "[He] should've sent Fakhar Zaman up the...order." "This is called selfishness...It's easy for Babar and Muhammad Rizwan to open the innings...and create...records," added Gambhir. "If you want to be a leader, you've to think about your team [instead of yourself]," he stated.

111.title: 16-yr-old Mumbai girl looking for hide-&-seek playmates hit by lift, dies
111.article_body: A 16-year-old girl was killed after she stuck her head into the square opening of the lift door while looking for her playmates during a game of hide-and-seek in Mumbai's Mankhurd. Reports said that the lift descended and hit the girl on her head. The lift had reportedly been made operational five days ago.

112.title: We tried to hurry Bumrah back and look what happened: Chief selector Chetan Sharma
112.article_body: While announcing India squads for New Zealand and Bangladesh tours, BCCI chief selector Chetan Sharma said that it is important to look into players' workload management. "We tried to hurry Jasprit Bumrah back into Team India squad and look what happened. We are without him in T20 World Cup," he added. "NCA team is looking after him well," Sharma said.

113.title: We stand with India: US as Morbi bridge collapse claims over 130 lives
113.article_body: After a suspension bridge collapse in Gujarat's Morbi claimed over 130 lives, US President Joe Biden expressed his condolences and tweeted, "In this difficult hour, we will continue to stand with and support the Indian people." "We stand with the people of India who are mourning the victims of the devastating bridge collapse in Gujarat," US Vice-President Kamala Harris tweeted.

114.title: Still fighting perception that I'm entitled & untalented: Janhvi
114.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor said that she's still fighting some people's perception that she's "privileged, entitled and untalented". "I am a hard-working girl who has something to offer. I am fighting to prove that to myself and other people," she added. Janhvi further added that she's learnt from her late mother Sridevi about how to survive in the film industry.

115.title: 53-year-old man stabbed to death while resisting robbery bid in Delhi
115.article_body: A 53-year-old man was allegedly stabbed to death on Sunday by two unidentified persons while resisting a robbery bid near the Narela Railway Station in Delhi, police said on Monday. The incident occurred when the deceased, a resident of Haryana's Sonipat, was going to the station to board a train. The accused tried to take away his bag, police added.

116.title: Strikes on Ukraine power grid in response to Crimea attack: Putin
116.article_body: Russian strikes on Ukrainian power grid and a decision to freeze participation in a Black Sea grain export programme were responses to a drone attack on Moscow's fleet in Crimea on Saturday, Russian President Vladimir Putin said. Ukrainian drones had used the same marine passages that grain ships transited under the UN-brokered deal, Putin added. Ukraine has denied the allegations.

117.title: Schools, colleges shut in 3 districts in Tamil Nadu on Tuesday amid heavy rainfall alert
117.article_body: The schools and colleges in Tamil Nadu's Nagapattinam, Tiruvarur and Mayiladuthurai districts will remain closed on Tuesday in the wake of a heavy rainfall alert by India Meteorological Department (IMD). The northeast monsoon season arrived on October 29 in southern India, following which several areas of Tamil Nadu have been witnessing heavy rainfall and thunderstorms.

118.title: Actors Manjima Mohan, Gautham Karthik confirm relationship; share pics
118.article_body: Actors Manjima Mohan and Gautham Karthik have confirmed their relationship and shared pictures on Instagram. "Three years ago when I was completely lost you came into my life like a guardian angel," Manjima wrote. "I've a peace in my heart now that I've never felt before, and that's all because of what you have nourished in my life," Gautham wrote.

119.title: Musk dissolves Twitter's entire board to become sole director, says 'This is temporary'
119.article_body: A securities filing has revealed that Elon Musk dissolved Twitter's board of directors to become the sole director of the company. According to the filing, Bret Taylor, Parag Agrawal, Omid Kordestani, David Rosenblatt, Martha Lane Fox, Patrick Pichette, Egon Durban, Fei-Fei Li and Mimi Alemayehou are no longer directors of Twitter. Musk also tweeted that this move "is just temporary".

120.title: We used to give away tickets, people sold them for ₹10 to buy booze: Rishab
120.article_body: Actor Rishab Shetty recalled that he and actor Rakshit Shetty used to give away tickets for their films to people outside theatres. "But those people would sell the tickets for ₹10 to buy booze. That was also a time we faced. But now, our work is being appreciated by people and everyone is supporting," the actor-director added.

121.title: Mumbai driver records drunken confession of employer's affairs, blackmails him
121.article_body: The Mumbai Police are on lookout for a driver who secretly recorded drunken 'confession' of his employer about his alleged illicit relationship with daughters of his live-in partner. The driver blackmailed both employer and his live-in-partner to send the recording to the daughters' husbands and extorted ₹10.70 lakh from them. The live-in partner filed a complaint after the blackmail continued.

122.title: 'Steel Man of India' Jamshed J Irani passes away aged 86
122.article_body: Dr Jamshed J Irani, widely known as the 'Steel Man of India', passed away at the age of 86 in Jamshedpur late Monday night, Tata Steel confirmed. Irani joined Tata Steel in 1968 and retired after spending 43 years at the company in 2011. The Padma Bhushan awardee served as the Managing Director of Tata Steel from 1992 to 2001.

123.title: Elon Musk to serve as Twitter CEO
123.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk will serve as the CEO of Twitter, according to a regulatory filing on Monday. This will be in addition to Musk running Tesla, SpaceX, Neuralink and The Boring Company. In a separate filing, it was revealed that Musk has dissolved Twitter's board, becoming its sole director after acquiring the company on Friday.

124.title: Instagram fixes bug that suspended multiple accounts, cut follower count
124.article_body: Instagram on Monday said it has fixed a bug that prevented people across different parts of the world from accessing their accounts and "caused a temporary change for some in number of followers". The outage reportedly lasted for about eight hours. Many users had complained about receiving messages that said their accounts were suspended.

125.title: Gautam Adani becomes world's 3rd richest person with $132 billion wealth: Forbes
125.article_body: Gautam Adani on Monday reclaimed his position as the world's third-richest person with $131.9 billion wealth. The 60-year-old industrialist overtook Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos on Forbes' Real-Time Billionaires List after adding $314 million to his net worth. Elon Musk is currently the world's richest person with $223.8 billion fortune, followed by Bernard Arnault with a net worth of $156.5 billion.

126.title: Passenger gets India-SA score update on tissue paper from pilot onboard flight, shares pic
126.article_body: A Team India fan shared a picture of a handwritten India-South Africa T20 World Cup 2022 match score update given to him by a pilot on a tissue paper onboard an IndiGo flight. "India lost today...but IndiGo ⁦won my heart. Pilot sent...note mid-air when requested for score update," he tweeted. "We're glad to see this," IndiGo responded to his tweet.

127.title: US Prez got angry in June phone call with Zelenskyy, said 'show gratitude': Report
127.article_body: US President Joe Biden raised his voice at Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy during a phone call in June, NBC News reported. Biden had reportedly just finished telling Zelenskyy about America's new $1 billion military aid when the latter started listing additional help needed by Ukraine. Biden became angry and said Zelenskyy "could show a little more gratitude", the report added.

128.title: Hope you are watching everything, Sai Baba: Prithvi Shaw after Team India snub
128.article_body: In an apparent reaction to him not being selected in Team India squads for New Zealand and Bangladesh tours, Prithvi Shaw shared a picture of Sai Baba on Instagram Stories. He wrote, "Hope you are watching everything, Sai Baba." The 22-year-old batter last played for India in July 2021.

129.title: 19-year-old Dewald Brevis smashes fastest 150 in T20 cricket history
129.article_body: Titans batting all-rounder Dewald Brevis on Monday smashed the fastest 150 in the history of T20 cricket. The 19-year-old South African crossed the 150-run mark off 52 deliveries against Knights in a CSA T20 Challenge match to break the record previously held by Chris Gayle (53 deliveries). Brevis, who is known as Baby AB, scored 162(57) in the match.

130.title: Will do films my heart says yes to, not for any other reason: Rajkummar
130.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao in an interview said, "I'm just going to do films I believe in, that my heart says yes to and not for any other reason." The actor will next be seen in 'Monica O My Darling', a neo-noir crime comedy directed by Vasan Bala. Rajkummar is also set to star in 'Guns & Gulaabs' and 'Bheed'.

131.title: Some couldn't come, we couldn't invite some: Ali as he shares pics from reception
131.article_body: Ali Fazal, taking to Instagram, shared a video featuring pictures from his wedding reception which took place in the first week of October. In the pictures, Ali and his actress-wife Richa Chadha were seen posing with Hrithik Roshan, Tabu and others. "I want to thank everyone...Some couldn't come, we were unable to invite some...but our love is...with you," Ali wrote.

132.title: Tamil Nadu logs 152 COVID-19 cases in 24 hrs; active cases decline
132.article_body: Tamil Nadu reported 152 fresh cases of COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, taking the state's total case tally to 35,92,043, the state health department informed on Monday. No deaths due to the infection were recorded. Tamil Nadu's active case count fell from 1,732 on Sunday to 1,602 on Monday, according to the daily COVID-19 bulletin.

133.title: Norway raises military alert level in response to Ukraine war
133.article_body: Norwegian PM Jonas Gahr Store on Monday announced that his country's military would be put on a higher level of alertness from Tuesday in response to the war in Ukraine. "There are no indications that Russia is expanding its warfare to other countries, but the increased tensions make us more exposed to threats, intelligence operations and influence campaigns," Store added.

134.title: We didn't get the start with bat: Ireland captain Balbirnie on loss vs Aus
134.article_body: Ireland captain Andy Balbirnie said his side didn't get the start with the bat in their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match against Australia. "But to show the fight at the end was nice. Looking at the scoreboard we thought it wasn't against us," he added. Chasing 180, Ireland were bowled out for 137 in 18.1 overs.

135.title: It wasn't the easiest wicket: Finch after scoring 63(44)
135.article_body: After scoring 63(44) and winning the 'Player of the Match' award, Australian skipper Aaron Finch said that it wasn't the easiest wicket to bat at the Gabba. "It was a lot slower than what we expected. They (Ireland) changed their pace really well and bowled a lot of cutters...it was hard to get a rhythm," Finch said.

136.title: Who knows if someone had stayed with Tucker: Balbirnie after losing to Aus
136.article_body: After losing to Australia by 42 runs, Ireland skipper Andy Balbirnie said the match was hardly fought. "Looking at the scoreboard we thought it wasn't against us, again the wickets column was a problem and who knows if someone had stayed with [Lorcan] Tucker," Balbirnie said. Notably, Tucker scored 71*(48) against Australia at Gabba on Monday.

137.title: Not here to be liked, having a great time with my team: Verstappen
137.article_body: F1 world champion Max Verstappen said abuse from Lewis Hamilton fans does not bother him. "I am not here to be liked, and it's not going to ruin my day. I am having a great time with my team," said Verstappen. He added that the abuse could be due to "frustration" as Hamilton "is not doing so well" this year.

138.title: Need to convert more chances: Ind hockey skipper Harmanpreet
138.article_body: After being beaten for the first time in the ongoing FIH Hockey Pro League, Indian hockey skipper Harmanpreet Singh said that the team needs to "convert more chances" into goals. "We were trying for different variations and combinations. But sometimes, they do not work out," Harmanpreet said. Notably, India lost to Spain by 2-3 in Bhubaneswar on Sunday.

139.title: BAI announces ₹5 lakh cash reward each for Sankar Muthusamy, Satwik-Chirag
139.article_body: Badminton Association of India (BAI) announced ₹5 lakh cash reward each for Sankar Muthusamy and doubles pair of Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty for their recent performances. Sankar became only the second Indian male singles player to win a silver at World Junior Championships. Rankireddy-Shetty became the first Indian doubles pair to win a Super 750 title at French Open.

140.title: Kerala policewoman wins 2 gold medals at World Arm Wrestling Competition
140.article_body: Kerala Police Assistant Sub-inspector Mini Raju won two gold medals at the World Arm Wrestling Competition held in Turkey. "This is the first time we (India) won so many medals. Also after 1979, I am the first one to win double gold for the country at the event," said Raju. She picked up the sport during a competition in 2018.

141.title: Partha Chatterjee's judicial custody extended in WB SSC scam case
141.article_body: A special CBI court extended the judicial custody of suspended TMC leader Partha Chatterjee by 14 days in the West Bengal School Service Commission (SSC) recruitment scam case. Chatterjee and his aide Arpita Mukherjee were arrested by ED in July. Cash worth around ₹50 crore, jewellery and gold bars were also seized from flats allegedly owned by Mukherjee.

142.title: We now have to nurture Tejashwi Yadav: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar
142.article_body: Bihar CM and JD(U) leader Nitish Kumar said that they now have to nurture Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav. Notably, JD(U) recently broke its ties with the NDA-led BJP and joined hands with the RJD-led coalition, which also includes Congress, to form the government in Bihar. Rejoining the NDA in 2017 was a "mistake", CM Nitish said.

143.title: Something may happen on sedition law in Winter Session: Centre
143.article_body: Attorney General R Venkataramani told the Supreme Court that the Centre is reviewing Section 124A of the Indian Penal Code which criminalises sedition and said that something may happen in the Parliament's Winter Session. The AG asked for additional time for the Centre so that appropriate steps can be taken. The matter was fixed for further hearing in January 2023.

144.title: 10 dogs & 2 puppies shot dead in Andhra medical college, case filed
144.article_body: A case has been filed against the management of GSL Medical College and others in Andhra Pradesh's Rajahmundry after 10 dogs and two puppies were shot dead on campus. The 'shooters' have reportedly been killing dogs for years as animals create "problems" for students. An alleged video of the dogs tied to a vehicle and being dragged has gone viral.

145.title: Rajasthan BJP legislator's son arrested in dowry harassment case
145.article_body: Rajasthan Police have arrested Prakash Garg, son of BJP legislator Jogeshwar Garg, in a dowry harassment case. Prakash surrendered before the police after the Rajasthan HC vacated the stay on his arrest. Prakash's wife Mamta, who is the daughter of Rashtriya Loktantrik Party (RLD) legislator Pukhraj Garg, had filed a complaint against him and his parents in 2020.

146.title: BJP leader, lawyer call for 'Truth Commission' over 1984 riots
146.article_body: BJP leader RP Singh and lawyer HS Phoolka have written to Home Minister Amit Shah and PM Narendra Modi respectively calling for a 'Truth Commission' into the 1984 anti-Sikh riots. Phoolka alleged "enough evidence" shows riots "probably" took place "under instructions" from former PM Indira Gandhi. Singh sought the declassification of documents pertaining to Operation Blue Star and the riots.

147.title: Amendment to counter 'perverse trends' will be proposed: Turkey Prez
147.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan on Monday said his party will propose constitutional amendments to protect families from "perverse trends". "While...unity between woman & man...is [being] scorned; perversion...& crooked relationships are being encouraged," he said. Erdogan and his party members have referred to members of the LGBT community as "deviants" or "perverts" in recent years.

148.title: ICC allows prosecutor to resume probe into Afghanistan atrocities
148.article_body: The International Criminal Court (ICC) on Monday allowed its prosecutor Karim Khan to resume his probe into atrocities committed in Afghanistan. The court observed that Kabul "is not presently carrying out genuine investigations" into the alleged crimes. The now-deposed Afghan government had asked the ICC to pause the investigation in 2020 so that Kabul could carry out its own inquiries.

149.title: India in talks to expand bilateral trade through rupee accounts: Report
149.article_body: The Indian government is reportedly in talks with African nations like Zimbabwe, Djibouti, Ethiopia, Malawi and Sudan to expand bilateral trade through bespoke rupee accounts. Along with this, it is also reportedly trying to internationalise indigenous payment methods. The discussions are aimed at replacing SWIFT by creating a separate payment ecosystem and overcoming dollar-dominated trades.

150.title: RBI imposes ₹5 lakh fine on LIC Housing Finance for violating norms
150.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) imposed a fine of ₹5 lakh on LIC Housing Finance for not complying with provisions of the National Housing Bank. A ₹1.76 crore fine was also imposed on Vakrangee Ltd by the central bank. RBI clarified the penalties were not intended to pronounce the validity of transactions or agreements entered into with its customers.

151.title: In pressure situations, make use of technology: Hogg on no-ball call
151.article_body: Citing instances from India-Pakistan T20 World Cup match, former Australia cricketer Brad Hogg said that in pressure situations, technology should be used to make the right decisions. "We have TV replays that can give us the right result," he stated. Hogg cited examples of waist-high no-ball signalled against Pakistan, Axar Patel's run out and Ravichandran Ashwin dropping Shan Masood's catch.

152.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning for several states for next 2 days, list released
152.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, issued heavy to very heavy rainfall warning for several states/UTs for next two days. It is very likely over parts of Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Mizoram, Manipur, Tripura and West Bengal on October 25. Heavy rainfall is very likely over Arunachal Pradesh, Assam and Nagaland on October 26.

153.title: What is Virat Kohli's record while chasing in T20 World Cup history?
153.article_body: Virat Kohli has scored 541 runs at a strike rate of 135.92 in T20 World Cup matches in which India have batted second. Kohli has scored these runs in 10 innings, out of which he has remained not out in eight. Kohli's highest score in these matches is 82*(53), registered against Pakistan on Sunday, and his batting average is 270.50.

154.title: How do the latest T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 points tables read?
154.article_body: New Zealand are on top of the T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 Group 1 points table with a superior net run-rate than Sri Lanka and England. Australia are last on the points table. Bangladesh lead Group 2, having superior net run-rate than India. Meanwhile, South Africa and Zimbabwe have one point each after their match ended producing no result.

155.title: If India think they can win WC without Virat, it's not possible: Inzamam-ul-Haq
155.article_body: Calling Virat Kohli "zabardast", ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq said, "If India think that they can win the World Cup without Virat, it's not possible." He added, "The Indian team is dangerous only on one condition, when Virat plays brilliantly. I'm telling this clearly." Kohli remained unbeaten at 82 to help India chase down Pakistan's 160-run target in their T20 WC match.

156.title: Congress is simply busy walking on the path of illusion: K'taka minister
156.article_body: Karnataka Health Minister K Sudhakar criticised Congress’ Bharat Jodo Yatra, claiming that the party is simply busy walking on the path of illusion. "With Bharat Jodo Yatra coming to an end in Karnataka, the big question remains whether it really served any purpose other than Congress’ classic divide and rule politics?” said Sudhakar.

157.title: Pakistan convinces Saudi Arabia to revive former's $12 bn refinery: Report
157.article_body: Pakistan has persuaded Saudi Arabia to revive the former's $12 billion refinery and petrochemical complex, an investment that was shelved during Pakistan PM Imran Khan's regime, according to reports. Saudi Arabia had planned the investment in 2019. They backed out after Khan allegedly tried to form a bloc of Islamic countries, outside Saudi-dominated Organisation of Islamic Cooperation's ambit.

158.title: Twitter user points out a typo in Shashi Tharoor's tweet on Virat Kohli, he replies
158.article_body: A Twitter user by the handle @perthinent pointed out a typo in Congress MP Shashi Tharoor's tweet on Virat Kohli. The user stated she thought Tharoor misspelled "authentic" as "authetic" in the tweet, adding, "But 'authetic' is a real word and makes sense in this context." Tharoor replied, "Thanks for coming to the rescue...@perthinent, but it was, alas, a typo!"

159.title: PM Modi congratulates Rishi Sunak, calls him 'living bridge' of UK Indians
159.article_body: PM Narendra Modi congratulated Rishi Sunak, who will become the first UK Prime Minister of Indian descent. PM Modi tweeted, "As you become UK PM...I look forward to working closely together on global issues, and implementing Roadmap 2030." He added, "Special Diwali wishes to the 'living bridge' of UK Indians, as we transform our historic ties into a modern partnership."

160.title: For now, we have a set XI: Mitchell Marsh on Smith's chances of playing vs SL
160.article_body: Australia all-rounder Mitchell Marsh has said that it's unlikely that Steve Smith, who missed their T20 World Cup match against New Zealand, will play in their second match against Sri Lanka on Tuesday. "We're early on in the tournament, things can change, but for now we have a set XI," he stated. Australia lost against New Zealand by 89 runs.

161.title: TN students attack toll plaza staff in Andhra; video surfaces
161.article_body: A video has surfaced showing students of a law college from Tamil Nadu allegedly attacking toll plaza workers in Andhra Pradesh's Tirupati over payment-related issues. The students were returning after an exam when they were stopped at the toll plaza. The clash continued for a while and some vehicles were damaged even after police reached the spot.

162.title: Bug in iOS 15.7.1 beta update causing Face ID malfunction: Report
162.article_body: Several iPhone users reportedly faced issues with their Face ID after installing the iOS 15.7.1 beta update. Reports said a bug in the beta update resulted in users facing problems resetting their Face ID on their devices. They were greeted with a "Face ID not available" error every time they tried to use facial recognition on their iPhones.

163.title: I would be happy if Kumaraswamy becomes K'taka CM: BJP MLC
163.article_body: BJP MLC M Chidananda Gowda said that he would be happy if JDS leader HD Kumaraswamy becomes Karnataka's CM. "Our community (Kunchitiga) should also be included in the list of Other Backward Class (OBC)," the BJP MLC said.  He further added that whosoever becomes the CM should include the Kunchitiga community in the OBC list.

164.title: Why were Zimbabwe awarded 5 penalty runs against SA in their T20 WC match?
164.article_body: Zimbabwe were awarded five penalty runs against South Africa in ninth over in their T20 World Cup match on Monday. This came after wicketkeeper Quinton De Kock threw his glove before collecting a throw, and the ball went on to hit the stray glove. South Africa were penalised as ball hit an object intentionally placed on the field of play.

165.title: India's best-kept secret: Odisha CM on pics of Chilika Lake
165.article_body: Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik recently took to Twitter to share some pictures of Chilika Lake. "Chilika Lake has been integral to Odisha's culture & literature. It is a nature lovers' paradise and host to a fascinating carnival of avian guests," he tweeted. Calling the lake "India's best-kept secret", he said, "This winter let's spend time with the symphony of nature."

166.title: John Shaw loved India, was compassionate, friendly: Infosys ex-CFO Pai
166.article_body: Former Infosys Chief Financial Officer Mohandas Pai on Monday said Biocon Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw's husband John Shaw "loved India" and was a "very compassionate and friendly person". "John was a...business leader who understood business strategy...and worked hard with Kiran to build Biocon," Pai said. John Shaw passed away on Monday.

167.title: K'taka government approves 11 projects to generate over 41,000 jobs in state
167.article_body: The Karnataka government has approved 11 development projects which are expected to bring in investment worth over ₹1.74 lakh crore. The new projects are expected to benefit the youth in the state by generating over 41,000 jobs. According to reports, out of 11 projects, eight are going to be related to clean energy.

168.title: Shinde as Maha CM is BJP's 'temporary arrangement': Uddhav-led Sena
168.article_body: Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena, in its mouthpiece 'Saamana', claimed that 22 out of the 40 MLAs in Eknath Shinde-led Sena will soon join the BJP. In its weekly column, Uddhav-led Sena claimed that Eknath Shinde as Maharashtra CM was a "temporary arrangement" made by the BJP. Everyone has understood that his Chief Ministerial uniform will be taken, Sena said.

169.title: Kannur University VC called me to facilitate an attack: Kerala Guv
169.article_body: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan on Monday said he called Kannur University's Vice Chancellor "criminal". "What other word should I use for a person who invites me to Kannur to facilitate an attack on me?...After Kannur incident, [he] wrote back to Raj Bhavan that [he is] not a security expert, so he can't give a report," Khan added.

170.title: Mohammad Hafeez criticises Babar Azam, says 'His captaincy is like a sacred cow'
170.article_body: Ex-Pakistan all-rounder Mohammad Hafeez criticised Pakistan captain Babar Azam after their defeat against India in T20 World Cup 2022. "Babar Azam's captaincy is like a sacred cow that cannot be criticised," he said, adding, "It's the third consecutive big game in which we're seeing flaws in his captaincy...but we keep hearing that by time he gets to 32, he'll learn."

171.title: PM Modi meets Army Major after 21 years in Kargil, pic goes viral
171.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met Major Amit on Monday while on a visit to Kargil on the occasion of Diwali. PM Modi had earlier met Major Amit in 2001 when the latter was a student at a Sainik school in Gujarat's Balachadi. PM Modi and the Major posed together with a photo which comprised their picture from 2001.

172.title: Govt should solve hunger issues and not discredit bodies: Kharge
172.article_body: Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge said that the central government should solve hunger problems in the country instead of discrediting the organisation. Asking the BJP to focus on the hunger crisis, Kharge added, "In the last 8 years, we have seen that there has been slow progress on this front." India ranked 107 among 121 countries on the Global Hunger Index.

173.title: China chip imports fell 12.4% in Sept year-on-year: Govt data
173.article_body: According to official customs data, China's chip imports fell 12.4% in September to 47.6 billion chip units, compared to 54.3 billion units in September 2021. The data was supposed to be released earlier this month but was delayed due to the Communist Party Congress. In the first nine months of 2022, total output was down 10.8%.

174.title: US teenager pleads guilty to mass shooting at high school
174.article_body: A 16-year-old boy, Ethan Crumbley, on Monday pleaded guilty to murder and terrorism charges in a mass shooting that killed four of his classmates at a high school outside the US city of Detroit.
