"We did not have the option of going for big shots as we were four down. We had the belief we could win...I would like to thank everyone who supported me," Hardik said.

350.title: Delhi cracker ban shows Kejriwal is 'anti-religion': Gujarat BJP
350.article_body: Gujarat BJP chief CR Paatil has called Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal "anti-religious" for his government's decision to ban firecrackers in the national capital. Paatil said Kejriwal and AAP were trying to come to power in Gujarat and asked the gathering he was addressing how they will "burst firecrackers". AAP has said the ban is based on a Supreme Court order.

351.title: Kidnapped 16-yr-old Dalit girl found dead after 4 days in MP
351.article_body: A 16-year-old Dalit girl, who was allegedly kidnapped from her village four days back, was found dead in a field in Madhya Pradesh's Guna district on Sunday. The exact cause of the girl's death is yet to be known, police said. The class 11 student was allegedly kidnapped when she was returning from school on October 19.

352.title: 30 injured after UP-bound bus carrying labourers overturns in MP
352.article_body: At least 30 passengers were injured after a private bus carrying migrant labourers to Uttar Pradesh for Diwali overturned on Sunday in Madhya Pradesh's Guna district, an official said. The bus was coming from Gujarat's Surat, the official added. This comes after 15 people died and 40 others were injured when an UP-bound bus met with an accident on Friday.

353.title: 'Doctor G' is based on true events: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana
353.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana said his film 'Doctor G' is based on true events. "All of us have seen it a lot of times, even in the news, how doctors are beaten up for no reason...they're just doing their jobs," he stated. "So that is also being shown in the film," the actor added. 'Doctor G' also featured Rakul Preet Singh.

354.title: Southampton hold PL league leaders Arsenal to 1-1 draw at home
354.article_body: Premier League leaders Arsenal were held to a 1-1 draw by Southampton at the Saint Mary's Stadium. Granit Xhaka scored an early goal for Arsenal as Stuart Armstrong netted a second-half equaliser for the home side. This moves Arsenal to 28 points from 11 games, two ahead of Manchester City, while Southampton are 15th with 12 points from 12 games.

355.title: No one doubts Max Verstappen won 2021 F1 world championship: Vettel
355.article_body: Aston Martin F1 driver Sebastian Vettel said "nobody doubts" that Red Bull's Max Verstappen was the 2021 world champion. Vettel said it would be "stupid" to deduct championship points from Verstappen as punishment for Red Bull breaching the cost cap. "The FIA should come out and make it, very clear, very quick or very soon," said Vettel.

356.title: Kashmir is a safe and peaceful place: Iranian diplomat
356.article_body: While speaking at a conference organised by the J&K People's Justice Front, Iranian Embassy's Cultural Counsellor Dr Muhammad Ali Rabbani on Sunday said that Kashmir is a safe and peaceful place. The conference was organised to highlight the common cultural and heritage relations between India and Iran. Rabbani also lauded India's religious harmony. He also urged Iranians to visit Kashmir.

357.title: 12 arrested for killing elephant calf in Chhattisgarh's Korba
357.article_body: Chhattisgarh forest authorities have arrested 12 persons and detained a minor boy for allegedly killing an elephant calf and burying the carcass in Korba. The accused spotted the calf on October 18 and allegedly poisoned it the next day. Later, a herd of 44 elephants to which the calf belonged went on a rampage and killed a man.

358.title: For you 'Saat khoon maaf': Javed Akhtar to Virat Kohli over his 82*(53) against Pakistan
358.article_body: Lyricist Javed Akhtar took to Twitter to praise Virat Kohli for his 82*(53) that helped India defeat Pakistan by four wickets in T20 World Cup 2022. "Virat tum ko saat khoon maaf. Thank you so much. Jeetay raho," he wrote. Meanwhile, Jasprit Bumrah wrote, "A match for the ages! A match that’ll go down in the history books...Well done India."

359.title: Wouldn’t have preferred anyone else with me out there: Hardik on stand with Kohli vs Pak
359.article_body: Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya penned a note on Instagram after India defeated Pakistan by four wickets in their T20 World Cup 2022 match. Hardik, who shared a 113-run stand with Kohli, wrote, "At a loss for words...Wouldn’t have preferred anyone else with me out there...One of the best games of my life."

360.title: IMD releases predicted path of cyclone 'Sitrang' in the Bay of Bengal
360.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has shared a picture showing the observed and forecast track of cyclonic storm 'Sitrang'. The deep depression developing in the Bay of Bengal had intensified into a cyclone at 5.30 pm on Sunday, the IMD said. The cyclone will cross the Bangladesh coast between Tinkona Island and Sandwip around October 25 (Tuesday), it added.

361.title: 5 people, including 4 teenage girls, drown in river in Bihar
361.article_body: Four teenage girls and a 40-year-old man drowned in the Punpun River in Hamidnagar village in Bihar's Aurangabad district on Sunday. The incident took place when the four girls aged between 13 and 15 years went to wash their clothes, an official said. Professional divers have been deployed to fish out the bodies, he added.

362.title: Iran's atomic energy agency says info leaked online following hack
362.article_body: Iran's atomic energy agency said that an e-mail server belonging to one of its subsidiaries had been hacked from abroad and information published online, state media reported on Sunday. On Saturday, Iranian hacking group Black Reward said that it had released hacked information relating to Iranian nuclear activities, saying it was done to express solidarity with the ongoing anti-hijab protests.

363.title: Had 'God syndrome' after 'Vicky Donor', felt like I'd arrived: Ayushmann
363.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana has said that he developed "God syndrome" after his debut film. "I felt like I had arrived. I think it happens when you get so much...success unexpectedly and you get the 'God syndrome'. However, I have seen several ups and downs in my life," he stated. Ayushmann made his debut with the 2012 film 'Vicky Donor'.

364.title: Punjab Speaker to give ₹1 lakh to panchayats not burning stubble
364.article_body: Punjab Speaker Kultar Singh Sandhwan on Sunday announced that he will give ₹1 lakh to every panchayat if farmers in that village abstain from burning stubble. This amount will be given from his discretionary quota, according to an official statement. "As people [are] getting aware about the harmful effects of stubble burning, they are abandoning this trend," Sandhwan said.

365.title: Man Utd must end relationship with Cristiano Ronaldo: Gary Neville
365.article_body: Former Manchester United captain Gary Neville said the club should "end" its relationship with forward Cristiano Ronaldo. "End it (the contract) this week or create a truce to get to the World Cup and then end it...It has to end," said Neville. He added that the club is "better without" Cristiano and manager "Erik ten Hag knows that".

366.title: 20,000 yaba tablets being smuggled to Bangladesh seized in Assam
366.article_body: A suspected drug peddler was arrested and as many as 20,000 yaba tablets were recovered from him in Assam's Karimganj district on Sunday. The seizure was made from a car while the drugs was being smuggled to Bangladesh. The action was taken by the BSF, vigilant troops of Mizoram and Cachar Frontier, police said.

367.title: Deep depression over Bay of Bengal intensifies into cyclonic storm ‘Sitrang’
367.article_body: The deep depression developing in the Bay of Bengal intensified into cyclonic storm 'Sitrang' on Sunday evening. It will make landfall between Tinkona Island and Sandwip close to Bangladesh's Barisal in the early hours of Tuesday. The cyclone is likely to bring heavy to very heavy rain in coastal districts of South 24 Parganas and North 24 Parganas on Monday.

368.title: Hasbulla jokingly punches Ranveer Singh at UFC 280, actor shares video
368.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh, who attended UFC 280 in Abu Dhabi, took to Instagram Stories and shared a video with Hasbulla. In the video, Hasbulla can be seen punching Ranveer jokingly. Along with the video, Ranveer wrote, "Hasbulla taking no prisoners." Ranveer also shared pictures with Steven Seagal and Steve Harvey, who also attended the event.

369.title: Credit to Hardik, Virat for their performances: Pak skipper Babar
369.article_body: Despite losing to India by four wickets, Pakistan skipper Babar Azam said that his team bowled really well. "All credit to Kohli and Pandya. It wasn't easy with the new ball. We had partnerships after 10 overs," Babar said. "We had a lot of positives [from the match especially,] the way Iftikhar played and the way Shan played," he added.

370.title: France defender Varane's injury less serious than feared: Reports
370.article_body: Manchester United's French defender Raphael Varane's injury is reportedly "less serious than feared" and he can "still have hope" of playing in the World Cup. Varane left the pitch in tears with a leg injury during United's 1-1 draw against Chelsea on Saturday. Reports say Varane is expected to be out injured for between three and four weeks.

371.title: Very happy with my bowling: Arshdeep after taking 3 for 32
371.article_body: Indian pacer Arshdeep Singh said he is very happy with his bowling after the 23-year-old cricketer took three scalps against Pakistan in Melbourne on Sunday. "I didn't work too much on myself, just trying to keep things simple...We were talking..that we will take wickets in the starting and will restrict Pakistan...All credit goes to our batters," Arshdeep said.

372.title: Story for future generations: Ayushmann on watching final overs of IND vs PAK in flight
372.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana on Sunday recounted his experience of watching the final overs of today's match where India beat Pakistan, on a Mumbai-Chandigarh flight. Khurrana said, "This story is for my future generations." He said, "I've never witnessed a collective uproar of applause inside an aircraft...Thank you team India and Virat (Kohli) for bringing in Diwali a day early."

373.title: My best knock ever in T20Is, I'm lost for words: Virat Kohli on his 82*(53) against Pak
373.article_body: Virat Kohli, who smashed 82*(53) to help India beat Pakistan in their first T20 World Cup 2022 match, said it's his best knock ever in T20I cricket. "I have no words, no idea how that happened. I am really lost for words," he added. He stated that his previous best knock was 82*(51) against Australia in T20 World Cup 2016.

374.title: 90,293 spectators watched India-Pakistan T20 World Cup match at MCG
374.article_body: As many as 90,293 spectators watched India-Pakistan T20 World Cup 2022 match at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, the ICC said. Reacting to the ICC's post on Twitter, a fan tweeted, "90,293 lucky people witnessed Greatest of All Time cricket match." India defeated Pakistan by four wickets by completing the chase on the last ball of the match.

375.title: Have lost my voice screaming: Sushmita Sen after India's win over Pak
375.article_body: After India defeated Pakistan by four wickets in the T20 World Cup 2022, actress Sushmita Sen took to Twitter and congratulated the team. "WHAT A GAME...Salute Virat Kohli, have lost my voice screaming!" Abhishek Bachchan also took to Twitter and wrote, "King Kohli!!! That's the tweet." Kohli scored 53-ball 82 in the match against Pakistan.

376.title: Kohli, Hardik break record of highest partnership for India against Pakistan in T20Is
376.article_body: Virat Kohli and Hardik Pandya on Sunday broke the record for registering the highest partnership for India in a T20I against Pakistan. Kohli and Hardik registered a 113-run fifth-wicket stand to break the record. The previous record was held by MS Dhoni and Yuvraj Singh, who had recorded a 97-run fourth-wicket stand against Pakistan in a T20I in 2012.

377.title: Shoaib Akhtar shares pic to question umpires for giving no-ball in India's last over
377.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar shared a picture to question umpires for giving a waist-high no-ball in India’s last over against Pakistan in T20 World Cup, apparently suggesting it shouldn’t have been called a no-ball. “Umpire bhaiyo...food for thought aaj raat k liye (Umpires...food for thought for tonight),” Akhtar wrote. Kohli slammed a six off the no-ball bowled by Muhammad Nawaz.

378.title: India equal Aus' record for achieving highest target in last 3 overs of a T20 WC match
378.article_body: India on Sunday equalled Australia's record for achieving the highest target in the last three overs of a T20 World Cup match. India chased down 48 runs in the last three overs against Pakistan to equal the record. Australia had also chased 48 runs off last three overs against Pakistan in a T20 World Cup 2010 match.

379.title: So inspiring to see Virat Kohli cry and smile: Shah Rukh Khan on India's win vs Pakistan
379.article_body: Following India's four-wicket win over Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022, actor Shah Rukh Khan tweeted, "So good to see a great game of cricket. So wonderful to see India win." He added, "So brilliant to see Virat Kohli batting...and so inspiring to see him cry and smile...and the background score of Chak de India!! Happy Diwali starts right now!!!"

380.title: Irfan Pathan shares video of Sunil Gavaskar dancing during India's run chase vs Pakistan
380.article_body: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan took to Instagram to share a video of Sunil Gavaskar dancing during India's run chase against Pakistan in the T20 World Cup 2022. He wrote, "What scenes here at the MCG. Even the great Sunny ji couldn’t stop dancing...Virat you are the real king." "Look at Sunny bhai's enthusiasm," an Instagram user commented.

381.title: To divert public attention: Cong MP on action against Rajiv Gandhi Foundation
381.article_body: After the central government cancelled the FCRA licences of the Rajiv Gandhi Foundation (RGF) and Rajiv Gandhi Charitable Trust (RGCT), Congress MP Jairam Ramesh said the move is aimed at "defaming the Congress". "They (Centre) recycle old charges against the RGF and RGCT. This is to...divert public attention from issues of day-to-day concern faced by them," Ramesh added.

382.title: 'Rishi Sunak isn't even British', says racist caller on UK radio station; host responds
382.article_body: A racist caller joined a UK radio station and said, "Rishi Sunak isn't going to win the next general election...He's not even British." The show's host Sangita Myska immediately corrected the man, and said, "Rishi Sunak was born in the UK...I think you are fundamentally a racist." Notably, Indian-origin Sunak has formally declared he's running for the UK PM's post.

383.title: The MCG pitch for Ind-Pak game had something in it: Rohit Sharma
383.article_body: After winning the game by four wickets against Pakistan at the Melbourne Cricket Ground on Sunday, Indian skipper Rohit Sharma said that the pitch had something in it. "There was a nice carry. Some swing and seam. Good to see from the bowling perspective...We knew we had to bat out of our skin to chase this," Rohit said.

384.title: Sena's Priyanka Chaturvedi criticises minister who slapped woman
384.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi criticised Karnataka Minister V Somanna for allegedly slapping a woman during a public event. "BJP Minister. Karnataka. Likely explanation: Not a slap on the face but blessings on the cheek," she added. Chaturvedi also accused the government and the National Commission for Women of being silent on the issue.

385.title: Deadline to submit bids for Future Retail extended to November 3
385.article_body: As per the modified invitation of expression of interest (EoI) for Future Retail, which is undergoing the Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process, the final date to submit bids has been extended to November 3. The final list of prospective buyers will be published on November 20, and the deadline for the submission of the resolution plan is December 15.

386.title: RPF officials save woman who fell from moving train while deboarding; video surfaces
386.article_body: A video showing a woman slipping while deboarding a train at Muzaffarpur station in Bihar has surfaced on social media. The video, shared by Railway Protection Force (RPF), shows RPF officials pulling her just as she was about to fall in gap between platform and train and be crushed under its wheels. She had reportedly boarded the train to defecate.

387.title: Kohli's best innings for India: Rohit on Virat's 82*(53) vs Pak
387.article_body: After Indian batter Virat Kohli scored 82*(53) against Pakistan on Sunday, skipper Rohit Sharma said that this was the best innings that Kohli has played for his country. "Taking the game deep was very critical...We were in no position to [get that target]. The way we won is more pleasing to us. Hats off to Virat" Rohit said.

388.title: Russian, British defence ministers discuss the situation in Ukraine
388.article_body: Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu on Sunday discussed the situation in Ukraine with his British counterpart, Ben Wallace, over a telephone call, Russian media reported, citing the defence ministry. During the call, Shoigu reportedly conveyed Moscow's apprehension regarding Kyiv's plan to use a "dirty bomb" in Ukraine. Russia has provided no evidence regarding the claim about Kyiv's intention.

389.title: UK's destiny lies in Europe, Brexit sold as a 'mirage': EU official
389.article_body: EU's industry chief Thierry Breton on Sunday said Britain's destiny lies in Europe and that Brexit was sold to the country as "a sort of mirage". Breton said this while speaking about the current political turmoil in the UK. "We have a country which is completely destabilised, and a political party as well," Breton added, referring to the Conservative Party.

390.title: Virat Kohli, you are special: Shahid Kapoor after India's win over Pak
390.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor took to Instagram and shared a picture of Virat Kohli after the latter scored a match-winning 53-ball 82 runs against Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022. "Virat, you are special. Thank you for today. If you believe and if you persevere, you become the vessel through which the world witnesses magic," Shahid captioned the post.

391.title: Cometh the hour, cometh the stage, cometh the man: Ravi Shastri on Virat Kohli
391.article_body: After India defeated Pakistan by four wickets on the last delivery in their T20 World Cup 2022 match, Ravi Shastri shared a picture of Rohit Sharma lifting Virat Kohli. Praising Kohli for his 82*(53), Shastri wrote, "Cometh the hour, cometh the stage, cometh the man @virat.kohli." Kohli came to bat in the second over after KL Rahul's dismissal.

392.title: Ayodhya sets Guinness World Record as nearly 16 lakh diyas lit, pics released
392.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government on Sunday shared pictures as 15.76 lakh lamps were lit in Ayodhya on the eve of Diwali, in the presence of Prime Minister Narendra Modi. "World record re-established...Ayodhya entered the Guinness Book of World Records," said a UP Tourism Twitter page. PM Modi launched the Deepotsav celebrations on the banks of the river Sarayu on Sunday.

393.title: Sehwag shares PM Modi's 'Rona band kijiye' meme for Pakistan after their loss to India
393.article_body: Former India opener Virender Sehwag took to social media to share PM Narendra Modi's 'Aap log rona band kijiye (Please stop crying)' meme for Pakistan after their defeat to India in T20 World Cup 2022. "Request to neighbours," he captioned. "I hope they don't break TVs today," a Team India fan commented on his post on Instagram.

394.title: If an eagle doesn't fly for 2 days, pigeons can't claim the sky: RP Singh on Virat Kohli
394.article_body: Praising Virat Kohli for smashing 82*(53) to help India beat Pakistan on last ball in T20 World Cup 2022, former India pacer RP Singh tweeted, "If an eagle doesn't fly for 2 days, pigeons can't claim the sky." Meanwhile, Merv Hughes tweeted, "How good Virat!!!! Outstanding!!" "Virat Kohli well and truly back to his best," wrote Ian Bishop.

395.title: There was no slap: Woman allegedly 'hit' by Karnataka minister
395.article_body: The woman who was allegedly slapped by Karnataka minister and BJP MLA V Somanna refuted the allegations saying "there was no slap". "I went there to ask for help and requested him to give land. At the same time, I fell on his feet and somebody said [Somanna] slapped me," she said. "It's just an allegation against [Somanna]," she added.

396.title: 'Sabka sath, sabka vikas' inspired by Lord Ram's values: PM Modi
396.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi during the 'Deepotsav' celebrations in Uttar Pradesh's Ayodhya on Sunday said the concept of 'sabka saath, sabka vikas' was drawn from the values inculcated by Lord Ram. PM Modi addressed a gathering at the Ram Katha park ahead of Diwali. He also offered prayers to Ram Lalla at the temporary Ram temple.

397.title: Salman Rushdie has lost sight in one eye, one hand incapacitated: Agent
397.article_body: Salman Rushdie has lost vision in one eye and one of his hands is incapacitated, his agent said in an update two months after the India-born author was attacked and stabbed multiple times in New York. "He had three serious wounds in his neck. One hand is incapacitated because the nerves in his arm were cut," Rushdie's agent added.

398.title: 7 including 2 minors arrested over software engineer's gang-rape in J'khand
398.article_body: Seven people, including two minors, have been arrested in connection with the gang-rape of a 26-year-old software engineer in Jharkhand's West Singhbhum, according to police. The arrests were made after interrogating some local residents who frequented the area in Chaibasa, where the incident took place, police added. The woman's wallet and mobile phones were recovered from the accused.

399.title: Scheduled outages introduced in Kyiv after strikes on energy infra
399.article_body: Scheduled "stabilisation" power cuts were introduced in the Ukrainian capital of Kyiv on Sunday "to avoid accidents" following repeated Russian attacks on Ukraine's energy infrastructure, Kyiv's power operator DTEK said during the day. The outages should last "no more than four hours" but may be longer "due to the scale of damage to the power supply system", DTEK added.

400.title: Been a beautiful year: Radhika Madan on completing 'Soorarai...' remake
400.article_body: Actress Radhika Madan took to Instagram Stories and shared a picture from the sets of her untitled film with actor Akshay Kumar. "It's a wrap for project number five of this year! It's been a beautiful beautiful year guys. Can't wait to see you at the movies," Radhika wrote. The film is a remake of the Tamil film 'Soorarai Pottru'.

401.title: Pakistan will not agree for neutral venue for 2023 Asia Cup: Engineer
401.article_body: After BCCI Secretary Jay Shah said that India won't travel to Pakistan for the 2023 Asia Cup, ex-cricketer Farokh Engineer said that Pakistan won't agree to hold the tournament at a neutral venue. "They (Pakistan) need the resources and foreign teams to play in Pakistan. They have been deprived of cricket for a long time," Engineer said.

402.title: One of the greatest victories under pressure: Rahul on Ind-Pak match
402.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi congratulated the Indian team for its victory over Pakistan by four wickets in Melbourne on Sunday. "What a thriller of a match against Pakistan...One of the greatest victories under pressure. Well done team India...Best of luck for the matches ahead [in the T20 World Cup]," Rahul tweeted. Notably, batter Virat Kohli scored 82*(53).

403.title: Russia's 2 largest banks open vostro account for overseas Rupee trade
403.article_body: Russia's two largest banks, Sberbank and VTB Bank, have opened special vostro accounts following permission from the Reserve Bank of India to facilitate overseas trade in Rupee. The banks have reportedly opened these accounts in their branches in Delhi. The vostro account enables settlement of payments in rupee for trade between India and Russia, enabling cross-border trade in Rupee.

404.title: I'm sorry if anyone felt hurt: K'taka minister as video shows him slapping woman
404.article_body: After a video of Karnataka Minister V Somanna slapping a woman surfaced online, the minister said, "Though I did not misbehave at all but if anyone felt hurt then I apologise and express my regret." "I was trying to make her stand aside, indicating her with my hand. There was no other intention...I have high regards for women," Somanna added.

405.title: Cricket can be cruel and unfair: Ramiz Raja after India beat Pakistan in T20 World Cup
405.article_body: After India defeated Pakistan on the last ball in their T20 World Cup 2022 match, Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) chief Ramiz Raja tweeted, "A classic!" He added, "You win some, you lose some and as we all know this game can be cruel and unfair. #TeamPakistan couldn't have given more with bat and ball. Very proud of the effort!"
